content.description:
An excellent route, with nice rock, fun moves and progressively harder sections.

A fingery start with bad feet leads to a series of left-facing edges topped by a mediocre rest below the orange bulge.  After recovering, pull past the mailbox slot, a small edge and a textured pinch and then decide if you want to dyno or crank on horrible edges to reach better holds.

The original finish heads right to a set of new chains(you can see the old drop through a few feet higher).  Or you can do a new finish by continuing over another roof and into a corner to another set of chains.
content.location: In the center of the wall to the right of the obvious glue start holds.

content.description:
Despite some poor rock at the beginning, this route offers great climbing past unusual features that require some thought and finesse.

Pull off the ground using a glue reinforced undercling and make a long move to a left-facing flake.  Keep moving right along slopey rails past a few more bolts and then do a brief crux  in a shallow corner to reach better holds.

From here, the character of the route changes to a more traditional feel - with cracks, laybacks, and dihedral climbing.  Veer left into the crack and do a few moves to reach a good rest on a hollow flake below the small roof. Pull over the roof, and work your way into the corner.  Traverse right around the arete and try not to pump out on the slopey rails on your way to the chains.
content.location: Rightmost route in the main overhang.  The route traverses slightly right the whole way.  A new route traverses left after the third bolt.
